ygData.subject: Disrespect Shall NOT Be Tolerated!
ygData.msgSnippet: * Dinobot watched as Necromancer took a step back from him, noticing that such a movement meant that he might be afraid or was in doubt. Or he simply didn’t

Subject: Disrespect Shall NOT Be Tolerated!
From: Carnage Dinobot <carnage@...>



* Dinobot watched as Necromancer took a step back from him, noticing that such a movement meant that he might be afraid or was in doubt. Or he simply didn�t know how to deal with the factor that there was a warrior ahead of him that was more aggressive that he had first pondered.
He kept his optics on the male bot as he spoke, listening to the tension in his voice.
So, this bot was named Necromancer?
He sneered at the name, thinking that it sounded a bit soft to him. But each bot chose their name, knowing that there must have been a reason why he had chosen one such as that.
But his optics narrowed as the fembot interrupted, his attention being averted to her as she spoke.
Noting that it seemed as if there was a bitter sense in her voice, almost snooty.
Dinobot growled as she spoke her name and then turned on the male bot, thinking of how they must be brother and sister at the mention of them being related.
It was fairly obvious. The fem seemed far too bitchy to be his wife or faience, too young to be his mother or other relation, so the only other conclusion was that she was his sister.
He growled at Hell Drak, knowing that such an attitude directed towards others was a bigger offense then he was sure she knew. It was disrespectful. 
And he wasn�t about to be disrespected by a bot such as her.
His voice was a growl as his tail sway behind him�*

� Such disrespect to others will NOT be tolerated within the Maximal force, I assure you.�

* The claws on his hands flexed, giving his point a rock solid meaning.
Disrespect WOULDN�T be tolerated, especially by him. Disrespect towards him was most likely to be met with being backhanded by a sharpened claw. 
If there was one thing that he believed in it was giving respect where respect was due.
Dinobot then turned his attention towards Necromancer, his aggression easing off a bit so that he was no longer glaring at him. A simple, blank look meeting the new bot.
The tension in his body had not eased off and his muscles nearly rippled with it, in face, when ever his chest expanded as a breath was taken in�they did.
Even though there had been no hostility shown he still had his doubts, clearly masked by his blank expression.
Dinobot backed off a step, giving Necromancer a chance to ease off and let him know that he didn�t take him as much of a threat any longer.
With a flat voice he spoke�*

� What are your qualifications?�

* With that he waited in the darkness, his armor reflecting the moons silver light perfectly.
But his question was clear if one could understand it. What were their skills? That was all.*
